required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Patient Satisfaction After Ingrown Toenail Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Patient Satisfaction After Ingrown Toenail Surgery. A Review of 1200 Cases

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, demographic characteristics (age, gender, which toe is involved, family history) of the patients who were operated because of ingrown nails were examined, and the post-operative satisfaction score of the patients was noted, and the recurrence rate and complications were recorded.

detailed_description.textblock: The study was designed as single-center, single-surgeon observational study. Approximately 4000 patients who were operated on by the same surgeon between 2015-2020 due to ingrown nails were reached by phone, and patients' satisfaction was assessed by using the Surgical Satisfaction Questionnaire (SSQ-8). Outcomes such as retrospective treatment processes and complications were asked using a questionnaire, and patients' demographic characteristics were also recorded.

primary_outcome.time_frame: At least one year after surgery
primary_outcome.description: SSQ-8 is a validated tool for the assessment of patients who had been operated on.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At least one year after surgery
through study completion, an average of 2 years
through study completion, an average of 2 years

study_pop.textblock: Patients who had ingrown toenail surgery between 8 and 80 years old.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Patients who underwent ingrown toenail surgery Patients who could be reachable by phone over contact details on medical records
Exclusion Criteria:
Patients who were not reachable Patients who underwent another surgery on the targeted foot rather than ingrown toenail surgery Patients who had fractures on the targeted foot Clinical diagnosis of Alzheimer disease or patients who have lost their cognitive functions.
